com.asgoc.common.code.json

Interface JSONManipulator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConcreteJSONManipulator

    public interface JSONManipulator
    Interface that specifies the required contract for a JSON manipulator. Most methods return references of instances which were used to call them to allow nesting of method calls.
    Author:
    Kaartic Sivaraam

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      java.lang.Object get(java.lang.String key)
      Provides the value of the given key in the JSON representation

    • Method Detail

      • appendPair

        JSONManipulator appendPair(java.lang.String key,
                           java.lang.Object bean)

      • appendArray

        JSONManipulator appendArray(java.lang.String key,
                            java.util.Collection<?> arrayCollection)
        Appends (key, array of JSON values) to the JSON representation. The JSON values is constructed from the Collection.
        Parameters:
        key - key with which the specified array of JSON values are to be associated
        arrayCollection - Collection of values used to construct an array of JSON values
        Returns:
        The handle of the JSONManipulator to allow nested operations.

      • appendMap

        JSONManipulator appendMap(java.lang.String key,
                          java.util.Map<?,?> keyValues)
        Appends (key, JSON representation) to the JSON representation. The JSON representation is constructed from the Map. The key is associated with the constructed JSON representation.
        Parameters:
        key - key with which the provided Map (that would be converted to a JSON representation) would be associated.
        keyValues - Map of (key, value) pairs that constitute the value of the provided key. The Map would be converted to a JSON representation.
        Returns:
        The handle of the JSONManipulator to allow nested operations.

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString()
        Provides the String representation of the JSON representation.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string that represents the current state of the JSON representation.

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString(int indentFactor)
        Provides the pretty-printed String representation of the JSONObject field.
        Parameters:
        indentFactor - The indentFactor used to generate the pretty-printed JSON string.
        Returns:
        A string that represents the current state of the JSON representation, pretty-printed with specified indents.

      • length

        int length()
        Provides the number of keys in the JSON representation
        Returns:
        the number of keys in the JSON representation

      • get

        java.lang.Object get(java.lang.String key)
        Provides the value of the given key in the JSON representation
        Parameters:
        key - key used to find the value
        Returns:
        value corresponding to the given key

      • getString

        java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String key)
        Provides the String associated with the given key in the JSON representation.
        Parameters:
        key - key used to get the String value
        Returns:
        String associated with the given key

      • getKeys

        java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> getKeys()
        Provides an enumeration of the keys in the JSON representation.
        Returns:
        Iterator that enumerates the keys present in the JSON representation.

      • getStringArray

        java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getStringArray(java.lang.String key)
        Provides a collection of the array of String JSON values.
        Parameters:
        key - key which has as it's value an array of JSON objects of the same type
        Returns:
        Collection of String JSON values
